Voted to strengthen federal bank oversight and protect consumers – as well as to ensure product safety and increase aid to small businesses.
voted for HR 2454-a bill to reduce global warming & create millions of new American manufacturing jobs – while protecting energy consumers.
Voted to improve our border security, port security, and disaster reilef efforts - and to provide more assistance to local first responders.
Voted to allow severely disabled veterans to receive both their retiree pay from DOD and their disability benefits from the VA (HR 2990).
Voted to improve health care for our veterans, increase benefits for disabled vets, and help veterans find scholarships.
Speaking this morning at a press conference in favor of the American Clean Energy and Security Act on the Portico of CityCounty Bldg at 10AM
Voted to allow the President to carry out his plans for turning mlitary operations in Iraq over to the Iraqis. http://tinyurl.com/nyj3lf
Voted to allow the Food and Drug Administration to regulate the advertising, marketing, and manufacturing of tobacco products (HR 1256).
E&C held a hearing this morning on my bill to allow the FCC to license thousands of new low-power radio stations: http://tinyurl.com/l8l2sz
Voted to provide economic incentives for consumers to trade in old gas-guzzling cars for more fuel-efficient ones: http://tinyurl.com/lyug4q
On June 12, analog TV sets that aren't connected to cable, satellite, or a converter box will stop working.  Get prepared at www.dtv.gov.
Requested a GAO investigation of the mishandling of veterans benefits claims at the Pittsburgh VA:  http://tinyurl.com/ku6afb
Called for greater restrictions on the sale of military equipment to criminals and terrorists: http://www.youtube.com/user/CongressmanDoyle
US citizens returning from Canada, Mexico, the Caribbean, or Bermuda are now required to have a passport or travel document approved by DHS.
National Academies of Science report supports my bill to ban Class B animal dealers: www.nationalacademies.org/morenews/20090529b.html
Veterans can now apply for education benefits approved by Congress in 2008 with my support: http://www.gibill.va.gov/ or call 1-888-442-4551
I hosted a briefing on a study funded by the National Science Foundation to develop a roadmap for robotics technology research in the USA.
The House Energy and Commerce Committee passed the Waxman-Markey clean energy bill I helped write - on a party-line vote.
I voted for a bill to protect credit card users from unfair interest rate increases, excessive fees, misleading contract terms and gimmicks.
I voted to provide law enforcement officials with new tools to investigate and prosecute corporate and mortgage fraud.
I just introduced legislation (HR 2413) to ensure that individuals with autism receive the care they need.
I voted in favor of the funding the President requested to wrap up the war in Iraq and protect the United States from other threats abroad.
I voted in favor of a bill that would provide $6 billion to modernize and upgrade school buildings to make them more energy-efficient.
A Toledo Blade editorial this morning praised my support for a bill to prevent an increase in the size of trucks on our nation's highways.
I voted to reform the Pentagon’s weapons acquisition process and save taxpayers billions of dollars - these overruns total $296 billion.
I'm going to use twitter to keep my constituents in Pennsylvania's 14th District better informed about my work representing them in Congress
